name: concrete production, 25MPa, for building construction, for interior use, with cement, Portland | concrete, 25MPa | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20148/documentation

This dataset represents the production of  Quebec 25 MPa ready-mix concrete. Density: 2"432 kg/m³. Ingredients (for 1 m³): Cement 279 kg, Water 166 kg, Gravel 1010 kg, Sand 955 kg, Fly ash 21.21 kg, Water reducing admixture 0,9 kg. ;;25 MPa concrete is intended for interior slabs not exposed to freeze-thaw, including residential, commercial and industrial uses (following the Canadian CSA specs - http://www.rmcao.org/sites/default/files/CSA%20Quickspec%202012.pdf). ;;Generic concrete mixes (cement, SCM, aggregate, water and admixtures) provided by the Technical Committee of Association Béton Québec (Canada). The amount of fly ash indicated above (about 7% of inputs) represents a theoretical average. Producers using it generally add 15-20% of fly ash in the mix. ;The average water consumption (not including batch water) is 65 L/m³ of ready mixed concrete. The average amount of water disposed is 35 L/m³. Water not discarded is recycled back into the process or into other products, and therefore not accounted for in this dataset.;;;Annual production volume of Ready-Mix concrete for North America estimated based on US production, and GDP ratio.;Distribution by ready-mix strength class:;- 20 MPa = 20%;- 25 MPa = 40%;- 30-32 MPa = 15%;- 35 MPa = 24%;- 50 MPa = 1%; ;(coherent with distribution presented in http://www.ermco.eu/documents/ermco-documents/ermco_-statistics2008_091310.pdf (Table 3); ;;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - concrete production 25MPa, RNA only, CA-QC, 2006 - 2006 (6b5cf61a-bb26-4e92-b577-e08f3d674f08)]

From reception of raw materials at the ready-mix plant gate.

This activity ends before the delivery of concrete at the construction site.
The dataset includes the whole manufacturing processes to produce ready-mixed concrete, internal processes (material handling and mixing) and infrastructure. 
The dataset does not include:
- the transport of concrete in a mixing truck. The combustion of 5.74 litres of diesel should be used to take into account the average transportation of 1m³ of concrete.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Quebec data. For some exchanges RNA or RER-modules have been used. Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical technology for average North American production. Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This activity represents a Quebec concrete production. Some flows have been kept as in the original (European) ecoinvent dataset (infrastructure, lubricant, rubber, and steel). The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data on process inputs were provided by the Technical Committee of Association Béton Québec (Canada). Water use is from Confidential Life Cycle Inventory Survey of Ready-Mix Concrete Plant (Marceau, VanGeem, and Ranchero 2006a). This survey was distributed to a sample of member-plants of the National Ready Mixed Concrete Association. The sample was chosen so that the plants in the sample are representative of climates of the conterminous United States and plant size in terms of production in cubic yards of ready mixed concrete. The sample consists of 47 plants.
